contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that Moses did not give the law for the righteous man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that law is not made for a righteous man

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Moses gave the law" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "which God has given me and made me responsible for" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: with which I have been entrusted

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God showed me mercy" or "I obtained mercy from God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "they have shipwrecked their faith" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: have been shipwrecked in respect to the faith

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I urge all believers to make requests, prayers, intercessions, and thanksgiving to God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I urge that requests, prayers, intercessions, and thanksgivings be made

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God desires to save all people and for them to come to the knowledge of the truth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He desires all people to be saved and to come to the knowledge of the truth

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Christ made me, Paul, a preacher and an apostle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I, myself, was made a herald and an apostle

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Adam is the one God formed first" or "God created Adam first" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will save her" or "God will save women" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "that the truth which God revealed is great" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that the revealed truth of godliness is great

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the angels saw him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "people in many parts of the world believed in him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: was believed on in the world

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "We should not refuse anything for which we give thanks to God" or "Everything that we eat with thanksgiving is acceptable" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Nothing that we take with thanksgiving is to be rejected

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "which you received when leaders of the church spoke God's word" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: which was given to you through prophecy

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People must be able to attest to her good deeds" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: She must be known for good deeds

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "All believers should think of the elders who are good leaders as worthy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Let the elders who rule well be considered worthy

contextId.information: This can be stated in active and positive form. AT: "the unbelievers might always speak respectfully about the name of God and the teaching" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
contextId.quote: the name of God and the teaching might not be blasphemed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "For the masters whom the slaves help with their work" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: For the masters who are helped by their work
